com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager.pages

Class PageGrouping

  • com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager.pages.PageGrouping
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RenderTarget

    public class PageGrouping
implements RenderTarget

    Maybe better called a "DocumentSection" this represents a group of Renderables that logically belong on the same page, but may spill over multiple subsequent pages as necessary in order to fit. Headers and footers are tied to this Logical Page / Document Section.

    Here is a typical page layout:

    Here is our model

    Put header/footer content wherever you want. We move the body as a unit as needed.

    Constructor

    • Constructor Detail

      • PageGrouping

        public PageGrouping(PdfLayoutMgr mgr,
                    PdfLayoutMgr.Orientation orientation,
                    Coord lowerLeftBody,
                    Dim bodyDim)

        Maybe better called a "DocumentSection" this represents a group of Renderables that logically belong on the same page, but may spill over multiple subsequent pages as necessary in order to fit. Headers and footers are tied to this Logical Page / Document Section.

        Here is a typical page layout:

        Here is our model

        Put header/footer content wherever you want. We move the body as a unit as needed.

        Constructor

        Parameters:
        mgr - the PdfLayoutMgr you are using.
        orientation - page orientation for this logical page grouping.
        lowerLeftBody - the offset (in document units) from the lower-left hand corner of the page to the lower-left of the body area.
        bodyDim - the dim of the body area.

    • Method Detail

      • pageWidth

        public float pageWidth()

        Width of the entire page (in document units). This is the short dimension for portrait, the long dimension for landscape.

      • commit

        Ends this logical page grouping and invalidates it for further operations.

      • drawLineStrip

        public PageGrouping drawLineStrip(java.util.List<com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager.utils.Coord> points,
                                  LineStyle lineStyle,
                                  boolean reallyRender)

        Draws lines from the first point to the last. Direction is important if using mitering.

        @param points the list of Coord to draw lines between. This does not connect the last point to the first. If you want that, add the first point again at the end of the list. @param lineStyle the style to draw the line with @param reallyRender Only render this if true. Otherwise, just measure and return. @return the updated RenderTarget (may be changed to return the lowest y-value instead)

      • drawLine

                             boolean reallyRender)

        {@inheritDoc}

      • pageBreakingTopMargin

        public float pageBreakingTopMargin(float bottomY,
                                   float height)

        Returns the top margin necessary to push this item onto a new page if it won't fit on this one. If it will fit, simply returns 0.
